text: when it comes to the Internet there is
one universal thing everybody has to
deal with whether you have one follower
or a million and that is bullies and I
feel like that term gets thrown around a
lot but at the end of the day it's
something that should be taken seriously
just because it's happening online
doesn't mean that it's not something
that can't hurt you it's one of those
things where if you respond to it people
learned that you will keep responding to
it and so they'll keep feeding off of
that don't respond just ignore let them
think that they're doing their thing and
it doesn't even affect you I know that's
the hardest thing in the world and I
even struggle with that people can't see
if you mute them so if somebody's just
spewing hate toward me I just kind of
say I'm good and if it does affect you i
would say reach out to other people for
help there are plenty of resources
online where people will listen to you
if you are going through something you
can even reach out to your friends or
your family or a teacher if you're
seeing it happen to somebody else the
one of the most powerful things you can
do is reach out to them and say hi I
don't think that too I think that you're
great I think that you're fabulous and
your smile is beautiful and you deserve
love freedom of speech is an incredible
thing but that does that does not mean
freedom from consequence and if you put
out something that's going to negatively
affect people that's your right but you
can't expect people to not respond to
that it was never my intention as a
youtuber to become some type of role
model in some capacity but that doesn't
mean that I shouldn't live up to the
challenge if that is my reality after
the fact if that makes sense
